originalText.text: I have been dealing with an awful leak since Jan 2023. I have sent dozens of emails and hundreds of phone calls with NO resolution. It‚Äôs leaking through the roof into my apt and my ceiling is about to collapse. They have not properly fixed it. They do not care about your apt. I have missed work to empty out buckets every time it rains. BEWARE. It‚Äôs now October 2023 and I had to file an official HP action against them that will force them to repair. They do not call back and always say someone is coming. Do not wait to report them. They have ZERO intention of helping fix anything.

originalText.text:
TrashüóëÔ∏è. Haven‚Äôt had a closet door in over a year. We finally made an official complaint with the city and they dug up a severely water damaged door from the. Basement and put it on hinges. UPSIDE DOWN. And yes the wood on the hinges are split which is how the last door fell on my Roomate after having a double mastectomy. They won‚Äôt get us a RIGHT SIDE UP door because they said they don‚Äôt have to.

We are still waiting for these cabinet doors to be replaced. As the cabinet door split in half and fell on my face in February.

originalText.text: Tenants have been reporting issues with broken garage door, flooded garage in addition to renting to weird funky tenants which they fail to realize that these issues comprimises their safety and livelihood.  Emails are ignored and these issues have not been addressed.  There is an influx of activities from strangers frequenting the property in Riverdale.   Our complaints and concerns are not being addressed by management.  No response received- garage door remains broken for over 3 months,  flooding issue in garage is continuous.  AE is not assuming their responsibility to address these issues- it's starting to affect tenants that have lived here for decades.

originalText.text: I‚Äôve lived in a building managed by them and I‚Äôve been here for 15 years. I am surprised at the negative reviews because I‚Äôve never really had issues. Yes there have been leaks and things to fix but they have always done things promptly, a couple times I had to call more than once but everyone is friendly and nice. They‚Äôve repainted my apartment since I moved in and also done minor repairs. The building is clean and they‚Äôve redone the elevator while i lived here. Once I was away and l my rent was delayed and they didn‚Äôt charge me a late fee or anything. Everyone super nice. I feel like I have fewer issues than most of my friends in nyc so I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend them.

originalText.text:
This is for 230 Ocean Parkway. Do not move here. The landlords are no responsive and corrupt as we found out the apartment was illegally destabilized.

In addition:
The buzzer on the front door has been non operational since the first week of November 2023

My bedroom has a leak unresolved since early November 2023.

The window in living room is broken and slides down when you open the one next to it.

There are 16 lead violations for my apartment, with children under 6 years old. The lead report they gave me upon move-in was an expired report since the laws changed.

Today 12/15/23 I had no heat, hot water, or plumbing.

The basement has been under illegal construction. (See photos)

The washers repeatedly stop working and no one comes to fix it.

It took over a year for them to fix bedroom doors and they only came when my toddler got stuck.

There‚Äôs a tenant on the first floor who smokes all day long and it seeps into our apartments  the landlords have done nothing.

The building managers, Nicholas Vlantes and Pietro Rimondini are repeatedly absent and ignore you.

Maintenance hotline will say someone will call you in 24-48 hours‚ÄîI‚Äôve never received that call in the  year and a half I‚Äôve been here.
